title.narrative: OUTPUT 3.1: Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH) - HEALTHY FAMILY BEHAVIOUR

description.narrative: Targeted communities in all districts have knowledge and skills to exercise healthy sanitation and hygiene practices by 2018., which contributes to Adolescent Health And Nutrition, Child Health, Health Systems Strengthening, Health â€“ General, Immunization, Maternal And Newborn Health, Prevention Of Stunting And Other Forms Of Malnutrition, Sanitation, Wash And Emergencies, Water. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Evaluations, Research And Data, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Access to high impact health, nutrition and Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH) interventions increased by at least 10 percentage points in four focus districts that have the worst child mortality and malnutrition rates

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Targeted communities in all districts have knowledge and skills to exercise healthy sanitation and hygiene practices by 2018.

description.narrative: Very slow progress has been made towards the target of 10 communities attaining ODF status as the government has not formally adopted CLTS as an approach towards eradication of open defecation. However, UNICEF engagement with government continues to enhance the enabling environment especially in sector coordination and advocacy for ODF. | Status:Not Met | As-of Date:31/12/2018

title.narrative: Number of communities certified free of open defecation that integrate standards for protection of girls and women as a result of UNICEF and partner support (leveraged/indirect)
